events.title: Founding of the University of London
events.description: The University of London was founded on May 12, 1820, as a degree-awarding university, providing education to a wider population.
events.significance: It was one of the first universities to admit students regardless of religion and laid the foundation for modern higher education accessible to all.

events.title: Hindenburg Disaster
events.description: The German passenger airship LZ 129 Hindenburg caught fire and was destroyed during its attempt to dock in New Jersey, resulting in 36 deaths.
events.significance: This disaster marked the end of the airship era as a mode of passenger travel and influenced public perceptions of air travel safety.

events.title: France Wins FIFA World Cup
events.description: France defeated Brazil 3-0 in the FIFA World Cup final held in Paris, securing their first World Cup title.
events.significance: This victory was a major achievement in French sports history and national pride, uniting the country through football.

events.title: The Soviet Union Tests Its First Atomic Bomb
events.description: On May 12, 1949, the USSR successfully detonated its first atomic bomb, known as 'First Lightning'.
events.significance: This development marked the beginning of the nuclear arms race during the Cold War and changed global military dynamics.
